description:
Using antibodies from survivors of ebola is actually a pretty simple idea. It works just like a vaccine, except instead of encouraging your own body to make the antibodies, you use someone else's. With that in mind, you could not only help those infected fight the disease, but, if it's successful, also immunize those who may come in contact with Ebola.
I understand the hesitation to even think about a cure before we can even figure out how many people are infected or how to track and contain them. I do think, however, that we should push for continuation of developing this idea becasue we can minimize the risk to others and slow the spread.
Here is the link for the article if anyone is interested.
summary: An article from the AAAS states that the WHO believes that using a convalescent serum containing antibodies from Ebola survivors has the potential to treat current victims.
title: Using Antibodies From Survivor's Blood is a More Than Valid Option
